You just have to play around with it. There is no "right way".

  ----- Ori=
ginal Message ----- 
  From: SnowfireL@... 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om 
  Sent: Monday, May 18, 2009 8:51 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] I have a =
question.






  Wish I knew how to "enhance" the correct way, because the=
y sure have a lot to say over there, and I all ready had my mom come throug=
h loud and clear last night again, even a little boy and dad maybe from thi=
s neighborhood talked directly to me, although for me it sounded like they =
were in a tin can.   There is plenty of other stuff coming through as well,=
 what do I care if people don't believe this, I do because, I know this is =
meant to be, and I am sure of it it's going to be something for other's lik=
e seeing is believing and there is nothing we can do for them, it's like th=
e Wright Brother's flying for the first time here people, they said how in =
the world will that big heavy thing get off the ground?  I say lets go for =
it, a machine will be found to make them come in loud and clear one day.  s=
f

  In a message dated 5/18/2009 9:13:25 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, evand=
uzer@... writes:



    Now I may be biased to the "investigation" wa=
y of doing things.  I do clean up evps if I hear something and can't make i=
t out do to ambient noise.  So hear is my question.  When do you stop clean=
ing up?  Wouldn't to much enhancing "taint" the results?  To me the more en=
hancing you do the less convincing it becomes.  I hope no one finds this of=
fensive, it is not meant to be I am just really curious.  The way I look at=
 it is that if you have to do so much enhancing to find anything, was there=
 really something there to begin with.  Are we just making ourselves believ=
e there is something there??

    Eric
